title: Haven't seen WW in months...
body:
...and now I know why.
They halved the duration and doubled the cooldown on his w, and cut his ultimate damage to nearly nothing.
I get that the red smite was broken on him and only him, but why in hell couldn't they have just made it so his ultimate didn't proc it?? They didn't need to make him unplayable.
Sure, he's one of the junglers who can survive the epic struggle with the Raptors, but that doesn't mean he shouldn't be able to do anything but ult.

Edit: Wow. I make twenty threads about things more important, and THIS is the one that gets attention!?! It's not that big a deal. He clearly needs work, just like Ryze is currently getting. They aren't going to do anything about it any time soon though.

In my opinion, the whole "2/3 of my immortality potion made me a wolfman despite neither of them coming from wolves" thing is a little derp. But if he MUST be a werewolf for werewolves' sake, I'm going to make a new thread with what I think would be a cool WW rework. (though it may do away with the relation to Soraka and Singed.)

Former WW main here. I stopped playing him in favor of junglers who can gank pre-6 reliably. WW's still arguably my best jungler though. If you play him smart and build him properly, he's very effective... post 6. He can be useful pre 6, but it's very situational.

He's still a comfort pick for me, and I will consistently play him well. But I'm Silver, where too people don't know how to play safely while I powerfarm. So WW's shelved for now.

On his nerfs: They hurt, but not nearly as much as they look. His W is still quite strong in team fights or to push towers/secure Dragons. And his ultimate, yeah it's less useful, but he still does want he wants to do with it. WW can't 1v1 with his ult and ensure a kill anymore, unless fed. But that's fine. That would be toxic. Instead he needs a team follow up.

What he still does well:
-Early clears: duh
-Early Dragons: a bit slow, but easily done at level 4, if not earlier. Just gotta watch the map
-Duels: not an ensured kill with his ult, but you probably won't kill him if even on levels
-Teamfights: isolate a priority target, sustain off them. W in fights goes largely unnoticed, but it's helpful
-Pushes towers: his waveclear isn't anything exciting, but then towers disappear. Especially with team help
-Itemizing: he has his optimal build path, but he actually has a variety of itemization paths. I prefer BoRK 1st, or 3rd

What he doesn't do well:
-Gank pre 6: duh
-Move about the map: lacks mobility. I use MS Quints for this
-Stick to targets: blue smite/MS Quints help
-Early dives: even at 6, it's iffy. Much easier later on you have armor

As for his kit, it's not toxic. It's just outdated. It's not interactive, fairly binary, and also pretty easy mode. WW's predictable in what he does, and QSS nullifies his engage.

If you know how to play the champion, you will NEVER have mana issues with him. Don't use Q in the Jungle (farm with W) and only use it to finish off a foe. It makes him stop for an extended period of time, allowing the enemy time to escape. You don't know what mana problems are until you play Amumu, who almost always needs blue: regardless of your mana management.

Amumu only has a slightly bigger pool than Warwick, but ALL of Amumu's abilities have bigger costs than his:

* Bandage Toss costs 10 more mana at ALL ranks

* Despair exceeds Hunter's Call in cost after 4 seconds (while Hunter's Call still has 2 more seconds to go)

* Tantrum has a mana cost of 35 (thus exceeding WW's free-to-toggle Blood Scent)
* 
* At rank 1 the two ults cost the same, rank 2 CoTSM costs 25 more, and rank 3 it costs 50 more

Amumu may have a bigger mana pool than Warwick, but Warwick has better base mana regeneration. Once again, Warwick's mana pool is the least stressed of ANY champion if you know how to use him. His clear is incredibly cheap in the Jungle, saving most of his pool for ganking. You should almost always back after ganking anyway.

Now, if you say that I cannot compare their kits, let me just say this.

Warwick has better focused damage, so in a teamfight he can lock down the ADC easily. Amumu has very poor focused damage, so he RELIES on his teammates to finish what he starts. Curse of the Sad Mummy does not keep the ADC from attacking (Infinite Duress does).

Their clear speeds are about the same, however Warwick will have more mana and HP coming out of the Jungle (he doesn't need abilities to clear, Amumu does). Amumu also has to take pots and Ranger's Trailblazer to sustain his clears. Oh, and I'm assuming that they are both using ONLY W to clear, since that's all they SHOULD ever use (unless they have Blue, obviously).

Amumu does have better AoE damage, but can go OoM if the teamfight goes long. He needs mana for his only gapcloser, so cleaning up might be hard. Besides having a targetted gapcloser, Warwick also has one that is completely free (Blood Scent); cleaning up is easy considering he stays healthy throughout the fight.

While Amumu has MUCH better pre-6 ganks, Warwick can secure an early Dragon at level 3 or 4. Amumu will take a lot of damage to Dragon at any and all stages of the game.

They are both weak to early invades, but later on Warwick has a better 1v1.

Now, I'm kind of insinuating that Warwick is strictly better than Amumu. This would be true (and was true) until the meta allowed tanks with teamfighting kits to become relevant again. AoE damage and CC which is seen on Amumu, Gragas, Sejuani, Zac, Malphite, Sion, or Maokai is favored right now, and teams are picking and banning accordingly. Warwick, Skarner, or Shyvana don't have this, which is why the current "tank meta" has left them out of the Jungle (Shyvana is instead a toplane monster).
